White rather falls in with White's plan here. Maybe White could play 14. Bb4 hitting the rook on f8, and after it moves, play Nc4 and maybe playing a bishop or knight into d6 at some point. Or maybe just playing Nd3 maintaining the tension. White has a slight spacial advantage in the centre, thanks to the pawn on d4 and so should be avoiding exchanges.
